education.institution: Turing School of Software and Design
education.area: Front-end Development (competed) Back-end Development (hired before completion)

highlights: Advanced into companies Lead Cloud Solutions Architect role after leading completion of Architecture transition to micro-services.
Provide Architecture support and guidance for multiple teams across several contracts.
work.position: Lead Cloud Solutions Architect | Software Engineer II

highlights: Volunteered to take on role of DevOps for the company. Transitioned architecture from monolithic codebase into containerized micro-services with full CI/CD pipelines.
Lead development of better state management on front-end by setting up immutable store services.
Improved teams development processes. Implemented coding guidelines and global linting rules as well as a revised pull request process to include code review.
Advanced teams professional development. Implement lightning talks every week to allow team members to share subject matter expert knowledge with the team while developing public speaking skills.
Trained 80-member team on correct inspection procedures of the A10 aircraft gun system.
Hand chosen to be dispatched to in-flight emergency of A10 aircraft belly landing to remove all explosive munitions from damaged Aircraft.

keywords: UX/UI - Adobe CS - Sketch - Invision Suite

projects.name: Leaderboard
projects.description: Built for a client that wanted a dynmic leaderboard system for smaller sporting events that updates in realtime to score changes. Also displays media of current run when there is an update.

projects.name: Devs Give Back
projects.description: devsGIVEback is a platform to connect non-developers with developers. Those out there that have an issue that can be solved by software can meet developers that are willing to volunteer their time and skill to solve civic-minded problems or issues that affect large groups of people.
